column4: the 2.6.17 does not work together with the jmicron-pata-controller, that manages ide-atapi-devices on all core2dou-boards
Jmicron problems?  now im famiilar with those ;)
i disabled my whole usb-controller so i could install
like disabled usb mouse and usb keyboard in bios?
i heard that was one fix , but i didnt have to disable my usb.  i had to install from a usb cdrom
in my bios i only can disable usb completely
:what motherboard?
abit ab9pro
so have u gotten ubuntu installed?  dapper/edgy?  hows its it working on the C2d?
works fine... just running it, but to get your usb back you have to make your own kernel... and thats a bit ugly here atm
realy? is there some c2d usb patch or something?
no the fix was made in 2.6.28 kernel as long as you use a higher kernel, you can use your usb, blew makes problems
thats the cause the ubuntu-users with new boards are so angry because nobody just upgrades ubuntu /kubuntu.. to 2.6.18 and you have to be good to get this working
so you
so you're using an old kernel now?
no, i run 2.6.19.1 but that makes problems with my x-server
problems with x server?  very odd...u dont mean proprietary nvidia/ati drivers right?
was anyone able to install Feisty on their Core 2 Duo?  I just got errors in both the GUI and alternate installers but feisty livecd booted fine
i have no tty1-6 and sometimes my x-server crashes completely without a chance to get logs
why widescreen, 1600x1200 see more/get more ;-)
crt though, right?
i just made a typo and now dont want to reboot
rm -rf /usr instead of rm -rf /usr/src/linux-2.6.19.1
i made a crtl-c after 3secs, but dont know what has been killed
uhhhh do sudo apt-get --reinstall install ubuntu-desktop
i have kubuntu, but thanks, ill try that
should restore basic functionality, /usr shouldnt usually contain too much personal stuff that shuold be in /home
try kubuntu-desktop then
i installed your kernel-package, but now i have the problem, that i have to install the nvidi-moduke on every boot
that's odd... i dont have the issue but i also use nvidia
i had to re-compile the kernel with your config only to compile my own modules
sorry, but if a sensory overload here.....i forgot which problem u were having that required a kernel compile?
i needed to recompile to make my own modules (ralink-wlan / nvidia)
you had to recompile a kernel in order to compile modules?
yes, very odd, but without it, it would not work, and even with that i have to manually set the sources-directory
can you repackage an unofficial cd of edgy with 2.6.19?
i dont know how that works
i tried doing that, but i didnt have much success....very difficult... i dont know how Muto managed to repackage sarge with newer kernels
